faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Below are answers to common questions about how we work, what we do and how to start a cooperation.
faq.q1: What exactly is your role in an energy project?
faq.a1p1: We act as an independent Energy Solutions Coordinator and Project Connector.
faq.a1p2: Our role is to structure the project, align technical solutions, source suitable suppliers and coordinate communication between all involved parties.
faq.a1p3: We do not sell equipment directly.
faq.q2: Do you work with specific brands or manufacturers?
faq.a2p1: No. We operate independently and are not tied to specific brands or manufacturers.
faq.a2p2: This allows us to select solutions based on project requirements rather than product availability.
faq.q3: How can we start working together?
faq.a3p1: The process usually starts with a short discussion of your requirements.
faq.a3p2: You can contact us via the website form or directly by email or messenger. After an initial review, we define the next steps and scope of coordination.
faq.q4: What information do you need from us?
faq.a4p1: At the initial stage, basic information is sufficient:
faq.a4p2: Additional details can be clarified step by step.

faq.a5p1: We currently coordinate projects across Europe, Ukraine and Africa.
faq.a5p2: Cross-regional and international projects are also possible.
faq.q6: Do you provide installation or EPC services?
faq.a6p1: We do not perform installation ourselves.
faq.a6p2: When required, we coordinate and align suitable EPC contractors or local partners as part of the project.
faq.q7: How are your services structured commercially?

projects.title: Projects & Use Cases
projects.subtitle1: Each energy project has its own context, requirements and constraints.
projects.subtitle2: Below are typical project scenarios where we support clients through coordination, sourcing and structured solution design.
projects.case1Context: A commercial facility operating in an area with unstable grid supply.
projects.case1Challenge: Ensuring uninterrupted operations during power outages.
projects.case1Solution: Backup generator system integrated with existing electrical infrastructure.
projects.case1Scope: Requirements analysis, supplier sourcing, technical alignment and delivery support.
projects.case1Outcome: Improved operational reliability and reduced downtime risks.
projects.case2Title: Hybrid Energy System for Remote Site
projects.case2Context: A remote site with limited or no grid access.
projects.case2Challenge: Balancing reliability, fuel consumption and operational costs.
projects.case2Solution: Hybrid system combining solar PV, energy storage and generator backup.
projects.case2Scope: Solution concept, technology matching, supplier coordination and logistics alignment.
projects.case2Outcome: Reliable power supply with reduced fuel dependency.
projects.case3Context: Infrastructure project requiring multiple generators across different locations.
projects.case3Challenge: Coordinating supply, specifications and delivery timelines.
projects.case3Solution: Centralized sourcing and coordination of generator suppliers.
projects.case3Scope: Supplier identification, specification alignment and delivery coordination.
projects.case3Outcome: Simplified procurement process and improved delivery control.
projects.case4Context: Agricultural operation aiming to reduce grid dependency.
projects.case4Challenge: Energy reliability during peak operational periods.
projects.case4Solution: Solar PV system combined with battery storage.
projects.case4Scope: Concept design, supplier matching and coordination with local partners.
projects.case4Outcome: Increased energy autonomy and operational stability.
projects.ctaText: If your project resembles any of these scenarios ‚Äî or presents new challenges ‚Äî we are ready to coordinate the right solution.

privacy.intro: We take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.
privacy.section1Title: 1. Data Controller and Data Protection Officer
privacy.section2Text: We process personal data of our users only to the extent necessary to provide a functional website and our content and services. The processing of personal data of our users takes place regularly only with the user's consent. An exception applies in cases where prior consent cannot be obtained for factual reasons and the processing of the data is permitted by law.
privacy.section3Text: We process your personal data in compliance with the provisions of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the German Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG). Data processing is carried out on the following legal bases:
privacy.section3Item1: When you have given us your explicit consent to process your personal data for specific purposes.
privacy.section3Item2: Processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which you are a party or to take steps at your request prior to entering into a contract.
privacy.section3Item3: Processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which we are subject.
privacy.section3Item4: Processing is necessary for the purposes of our legitimate interests, except where such interests are overridden by your interests or fundamental rights and freedoms.
privacy.section4Text: The provider of the website automatically collects and stores information in server log files, which your browser automatically transmits to us. These include:
privacy.section4Item6: Date and time of the request
privacy.section4Legal: Legal Basis: Art. 6 (1) f GDPR (legitimate interest in ensuring system security and optimizing our website)
privacy.section4Retention: Retention Period: Log files are automatically deleted after 14 days
privacy.section5Text: If you contact us via the contact form or email, your provided data will be stored for the purpose of processing your inquiry and in case of follow-up questions. We will not pass on this data without your consent.
privacy.section5Legal: Legal Basis: Art. 6 (1) a GDPR (consent), Art. 6 (1) b GDPR (pre-contractual measures)
privacy.section5Retention: Retention Period: Contact inquiries are stored for 2 years from the last contact. Project-related data is retained for the duration of the project plus 3 years for warranty and legal purposes.
privacy.section6Text: Our website uses cookies. Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device and saved by your browser. Cookies do not cause any damage to your computer and do not contain viruses.
privacy.section6Essential: Essential Cookies: Required for basic website functionality (session management, security)
privacy.section6Analytics: Analytics Cookies: Help us understand how visitors use our website (can be disabled)
privacy.section6Legal: Legal Basis: Essential cookies are based on Art. 6 (1) f GDPR (legitimate interest). Analytics cookies require consent according to ¬ß 25 TTDSG and Art. 6 (1) a GDPR.
privacy.section6Control: Cookie Control: You can configure your browser to inform you about cookie placement and decide individually whether to accept them, or to reject cookies in certain cases or generally. Each browser differs in how it manages cookie settings.
privacy.section7Text: We currently do not use third-party analytics tools such as Google Analytics. Should we decide to integrate such services in the future, we will update this privacy policy accordingly and obtain your consent where required.
privacy.section8Text: We use appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your data against accidental or intentional manipulation, partial or complete loss, destruction, or unauthorized access by third parties. Our security measures are continuously improved in line with technological developments.
privacy.section9Text: We do not sell or rent your personal data to third parties. We only share your data in the following cases:
privacy.section9Item1: We work with external service providers (hosting, email services) who process data on our behalf under strict data processing agreements (Art. 28 GDPR).
privacy.section9Item2: With your explicit consent, we may share relevant project information with suppliers, manufacturers, or other project partners.
privacy.section9Item3: We may disclose data if required by law, court order, or regulatory authority.
privacy.section10Text: We primarily process data within the European Union (EU) and European Economic Area (EEA). If data is transferred to countries outside the EU/EEA, we ensure adequate safeguards are in place:
privacy.section10Item1: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the EU Commission
privacy.section10Item2: Adequacy decisions by the EU Commission
privacy.section11Title: 11. Your Rights as a Data Subject
privacy.section11Text: Under GDPR, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:
privacy.section11Right1: You have the right to obtain confirmation as to whether personal data concerning you is being processed and, if so, to access this data and receive information about the processing.
privacy.section11Right2: You have the right to request correction of inaccurate personal data and completion of incomplete data.
privacy.section11Right3: You have the right to request deletion of your personal data without undue delay under certain circumstances.
privacy.section11Right4Title: Right to Restriction of Processing (Art. 18 GDPR):
privacy.section11Right4: You have the right to request restriction of processing under certain conditions.
privacy.section11Right5: You have the right to receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format and to transmit this data to another controller.
privacy.section11Right6: You have the right to object at any time to processing of your personal data based on legitimate interests (Art. 6(1) f GDPR).
privacy.section11Right7: If processing is based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. The withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
privacy.section11Exercise: How to Exercise Your Rights: To exercise any of these rights, please contact us at privacy@numo-energy.com or by mail to NUMO Energy Solutions GmbH, Kantstra√üe 164, 10623 Berlin, Germany.
privacy.section12Text: We process and store your personal data only for the period necessary to achieve the purpose of storage or as required by law. The retention periods are:

privacy.section12Item2: Duration of project cooperation plus 3 years for warranty and legal requirements
privacy.section12Item3: 10 years according to German commercial and tax law (HGB, AO)

privacy.section13AuthorityName: Berliner Beauftragte f√ºr Datenschutz und Informationsfreiheit
